course.title: Intermediate Sanskrit I
course.meeting_text: M., W., F., at 1; M., at 12
course.faculty_text: Parimal G. Patil and members of the Department
course.description: A reading course designed to give students the tools necessary for advanced study in Classical Sanskrit. Readings in epic (itihasa) or narrative (katha), poetry (kavya) or systematic thought (sastra) will introduce students to a variety of important genres and their distinctive conventions. A focus upon the Sanskrit tradition's categories of analysis - grammatical, commentarial and prosodic - will enable students to begin to make sense of original Sanskrit texts as generations of the tradition's own readers have.
